pros: Nice campus, beautiful views, decent pay
One of the first community colleges turned into a state university in New York having one of the best nursing programs in the state.
cons: The communication between departments and affairs could be better/.

review_title: Could be a great place to work
pros: The positives are that the college cares about the students. It seems like they want to retain good employees but are not sure how. Overall employees are treated well and if someone can handle taking things at a very slow pace it's an ok place to work. The benefits are great and the salaries are pretty good for the area. They are flexible with time off.
cons: The administration seems very resistant to change. The school seems lost in time in many ways and needs to get up to date and stop being so resistant to change. The civil service employees can be hard to deal with since they are used to relying on their union to protect them while they do as little work as possible and are allowed to be totally unprofessional. The state worker mentality is pervasive. Many of the promotions are given based on politics and not performance. This could be a good place to work if the management would listen to the input of the staff that work hard. There is not much in the budget for professional development.

review_title: Has a very skewed way of classifying employees and the pay scale is very strange for non faculty employees
pros: Nice working environment but little opportunity
cons: Hires temps from an agency. rather than allowing part time current employees opportunity to take hours. Part time max is 19 hours. Part timers end up training temps who then will work a 40 hour week through the temp agency.

review_title: Great place to work for students
pros: hours are very flexible, good benefits, management was good, the job gave a feeling of self-worth as well as improved my own abilities and made me a better student.
cons: Very few Cons, I had no issues working here at all.

job_title: Administrative Assistant Specialist in Middletown, NY
pros: The staff was lovely. The campus is beautiful. The environment was very conducive to learning. Administration was very supportive. Opportunities for growth.
cons: Parking could be a problem at times, but great place to work.

review_title: Strong organization that helps the people and institution it serves
pros: Invested Board committed to the organization
cons: Needs more support and program staff

pros: Decent pay, encouraging AVPs and VPs

pros: Room for transfers within campus departments.
